resources.string: Made By\nChandrakant M and Vivek S

âœ… Season: Rabi (Winter).

 âœ… Climate: Prefers cool temperatures (10-15Â°C) with moderate irrigation.

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained loamy and black soil.

 âœ… Usage: Used for making bread, chapati, and bakery products.

 âœ… Maharashtra Relevance: Grown in irrigated regions like Pune, Nashik, and Vidarbha.

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers and Time Period

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (Oct-Nov): Plow deeply, apply 10-12 tons/ha FYM.

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (Nov-Dec): Drilling method (4-5 cm depth, 20 cm row spacing). Seed rate: 100-125 kg/ha.

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (Dec-Feb): 100 kg N, 50 kg P, 50 kg K/ha before sowing; 40 kg N/ha after 30-40 days.

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation and Weed Control (Dec-Mar): 4-6 irrigations; Isoproturon (0.75 kg/ha) for weeds.

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest and Disease Management:

 Pests: Aphids, termites â€“ Chlorpyrifos (2ml/L).

 Diseases: Rust, smut â€“ Mancozeb (2g/L).

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Mar-Apr): 120-140 days; golden grains indicate maturity. Yield: 3-5 tons/ha.

âœ… Season: Rabi (Winter) and Kharif (Monsoon).

 âœ… Climate: Thrives in dry conditions with moderate rainfall (25-75 cm).

 âœ… Soil: Best grown in black cotton soil with good moisture retention.

 âœ… Usage: Used for making roti (bhakri), fodder for livestock, and food processing.

 âœ… Maharashtra Relevance: A staple crop in drought-prone areas, supporting food security.

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers and Time Period

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (Oct-Nov): Plow 2-3 times, apply 5-10 tons/ha FYM.

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (Mid-Nov - Early Dec): Drilling method (2-3 cm depth, 45 cm row spacing). Seed rate: 8-10 kg/ha.

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (Dec-Feb): 40-50 kg N, 40 kg P, 40 kg K/ha before sowing; 25 kg N/ha after 30-35 days.

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation and Weed Control (Dec-Mar): Rain-fed crop but two irrigations (30-40 and 60-70 days) improve yield. Atrazine (0.5 kg/ha) for weeds.

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest and Disease Management:

 Pests: Stem borer, shoot fly â€“ Neem oil or Chlorpyrifos (2ml/L).

 Diseases: Leaf blight, rust â€“ Mancozeb (2g/L).

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Mar-Apr): 110-120 days; grains should be dry and hard. Yield: 2.5-3.5 tons/ha.

âœ… Season: Kharif (Monsoon).

 âœ… Climate: Drought-tolerant, needs 40-50 cm rainfall.

 âœ… Soil: Best in sandy, well-drained soil.

 âœ… Usage: Used in bhakri, porridge, and fodder.

 âœ… Maharashtra Relevance: Grown in dryland farming regions like Marathwada.

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers and Time Period

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (May-June): Plow 2-3 times, apply 5-8 tons/ha FYM.

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (June-July): Drilling or broadcasting (2-3 cm depth, 45 cm row spacing). Seed rate: 3-4 kg/ha.

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (July-Sept): 40 kg N, 20 kg P, 20 kg K/ha before sowing; 20 kg N/ha after 30 days.

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation and Weed Control (July-Sept): Rain-fed; one irrigation at 30-40 days improves yield. Atrazine (0.5 kg/ha) for weeds.

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest and Disease Management:

 Pests: Shoot fly, aphids â€“ Neem oil or Dimethoate (2ml/L).

 Diseases: Downy mildew â€“ Metalaxyl (2g/L).

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Sept-Oct): 90-110 days. Yield: 1.5-2.5 tons/ha.

âœ… Season: Kharif (Monsoon).

 âœ… Climate: Prefers warm temperatures (20-30Â°C) with moderate rainfall (60-100 cm).

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained black and loamy soil.

 âœ… Usage: Used for oil extraction, animal feed, and protein-rich food.

 âœ… Maharashtra Relevance: Grown extensively in Vidarbha and Marathwada.

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers and Time Period

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (May-June): Deep plowing, apply 8-10 tons/ha FYM.

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (June-July): Drilling method (3-4 cm depth, 45 cm row spacing). Seed rate: 75-100 kg/ha.

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (July-Sept): 30-40 kg N, 60 kg P, 30 kg K/ha before sowing.

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation and Weed Control (July-Sept): Rain-fed, but one irrigation at pod formation boosts yield. Pendimethalin (1 kg/ha) for weeds.

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest and Disease Management:

 Pests: Pod borer, aphids â€“ Neem oil or Imidacloprid (2ml/L).

 Diseases: Rust, anthracnose â€“ Mancozeb (2g/L).

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Oct-Nov): 90-110 days. Yield: 2-3 tons/ha.

âœ… Season: Kharif (Monsoon).

 âœ… Climate: Requires high rainfall (100-150 cm).

 âœ… Soil: Best in clayey and alluvial soil.

 âœ… Usage: Staple food in India.

 âœ… Maharashtra Relevance: Grown in Konkan, Western Maharashtra.

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers and Time Period

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (May-June): Leveling and puddling, apply 10-12 tons/ha FYM.

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (June-July): Transplanting method (20 cm row spacing). Seed rate: 25-30 kg/ha.

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (July-Sept): 60 kg N, 40 kg P, 40 kg K/ha before transplanting.

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation and Weed Control (July-Oct): Continuous standing water. Pretilachlor (1 kg/ha) for weeds.

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest and Disease Management:

 Pests: Stem borer, leaf folder â€“ Chlorpyrifos (2ml/L).

 Diseases: Blast, bacterial blight â€“ Mancozeb (2g/L).

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Oct-Nov): 120-150 days. Yield: 3-6 tons/ha.

âœ… Season: Rabi (Winter).

 âœ… Climate: Requires cool temperatures (20-25Â°C) with moderate rainfall (40-60 cm).

 âœ… Soil: Best in well-drained loamy or black cotton soil.

 âœ… Usage: Used in dal, flour (besan), and various food products.

 âœ… Maharashtra Relevance: Major pulse crop in Vidarbha and Marathwada due to its drought tolerance.

 Cultivation Process with Fertilizers and Time Period

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (Oct-Nov): Deep plowing, apply 5-8 tons/ha FYM.

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (Nov-Dec): Drilling method (3-4 cm depth, 30 cm row spacing). Seed rate: 75-100 kg/ha.

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (Dec-Jan): 20-30 kg N, 50 kg P, 30 kg K/ha before sowing.

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation and Weed Control (Dec-Feb): Rain-fed crop, but one irrigation at pod development boosts yield. Pendimethalin (1 kg/ha) for weeds.

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest and Disease Management:

 Pests: Pod borer â€“ Neem oil or Spinosad (1ml/L).

 Diseases: Wilt, blight â€“ Mancozeb (2g/L).

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Feb-March): 110-120 days. Pods turn yellowish-brown when mature. Yield: 1.5-2.5 tons/ha.

âœ… Season: Summer (March â€“ June).

 âœ… Climate: Requires warm, humid conditions with rainfall 75-250 cm.

 âœ… Soil: Best in well-drained loamy soil with good organic content.

 âœ… Usage: Consumed fresh, in juices, pickles, and pulp-based products.

 âœ… Maharashtra Relevance: Grown in Konkan region (Ratnagiri, Sindhudurg, Raigad).

 Cultivation Process and Time Period

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (June-July): Deep plowing, FYM 10-15 tons/ha applied.

 2ï¸âƒ£ Planting (July-August): Grafted saplings at 8x8m spacing.

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (Aug-Nov): Nitrogen (500g), Phosphorus (250g), Potassium (500g/tree) annually.

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation and Weed Control (Nov-May): Drip irrigation; Mulching prevents weeds.

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest and Disease Management:

 Pests: Mango hopper.

 Diseases: Powdery mildew â€“ Neem oil or Carbendazim (1g/L).

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (March-June): 3-5 years for fruiting. Yield: 10-15 tons/ha.
ğŸŒ Banana \n(Grand Naine, Rasthali, Rajeli, Safed Velchi)

âœ… Season: Grown year-round, main season July-October.

 âœ… Climate: Needs 27-30Â°C and high humidity with 150-200 cm rainfall.

 âœ… Soil: Best in well-drained alluvial soil.

 âœ… Usage: Fresh consumption, chips, pulp, fiber extraction.

 âœ… Maharashtra Relevance: Grown in Jalgaon, Pune, Nashik.

 Cultivation Process and Time Period

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (June): Deep plowing, FYM 25-30 tons/ha applied.

 2ï¸âƒ£ Planting (July-August): Tissue culture plants at 1.5x1.5m spacing.

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (Aug-Nov): 200g N, 100g P, 300g K/plant.

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation and Weed Control (Aug-May): Drip irrigation, mulching for weed control.

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest and Disease Management:

 Diseases: Sigatoka, nematodes â€“ Copper oxychloride (3g/L water).

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Sept-Dec): 10-12 months after planting. Yield: 40-50 tons/ha.

âœ… Season: Grown year-round, peak season October-March.

 âœ… Climate: Thrives in hot, dry climate, rainfall 50-70 cm.

 âœ… Soil: Prefers light loamy or sandy soil.

 âœ… Usage: Consumed fresh, juice, medicinal uses.

 âœ… Maharashtra Relevance: Solapur, Nashik, Ahmednagar.

 Cultivation Process and Time Period

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (April-May): Plowing, 10-15 tons/ha FYM applied.

 2ï¸âƒ£ Planting (June-July): 3x3m spacing, drip irrigation system.

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (July-Dec): 250g N, 125g P, 250g K/plant.

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation and Weed Control (July-Jan): Drip irrigation, manual weeding.

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest and Disease Management:

 Disease: Bacterial blight â€“ Streptocycline spray (500 ppm).

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Oct-March): 18-24 months after planting. Yield: 12-15 tons/ha.
ğŸ‰ Watermelon \n (Sugar Baby, Kiran, Black Diamond)

âœ… Season: Summer (Feb-May).

 âœ… Climate: Requires warm temperatures (25-35Â°C) and low humidity.

 âœ… Soil: Best in sandy loam soil with good drainage.

 âœ… Usage: Consumed fresh, in juices, salads, and desserts.

 âœ… Maharashtra Relevance: Cultivated in Nashik, Pune, Solapur, Ahmednagar.

 ğŸŒ± Cultivation Process and Time Period

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (Dec-Jan): Deep plowing, FYM 8-10 tons/ha applied.

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (Jan-Feb): Direct seed sowing at 1.5x1m spacing.

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (Feb-April): 60 kg N, 30 kg P, 50 kg K/ha.

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation and Weed Control (Feb-May): Drip irrigation, plastic mulch for weed control.

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest and Disease Management:

 Pests: Aphids â€“ Neem oil spray.
 Diseases: Powdery mildew â€“ Carbendazim (1g/L water).

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (April-May): 70-90 days after sowing. Yield: 25-30 tons/ha.
ğŸˆ Papaya \n (Red Lady, Pusa Delicious, Arka Prabhath)

âœ… Season: Grown year-round, best planting in June and October.

 âœ… Climate: Requires warm, humid climate (21-33Â°C).

 âœ… Soil: Best in well-drained sandy loam soil.

 âœ… Usage: Consumed fresh, used in juices, jams, and cosmetics.

 âœ… Maharashtra Relevance: Cultivated in Aurangabad, Pune, Jalgaon.

 Cultivation Process and Time Period

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (May and Sept): Deep plowing, 10-15 tons/ha FYM applied.

 2ï¸âƒ£ Planting (June and Oct): 1.8x1.8m spacing, drip irrigation setup.

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (July-Feb): 250g N, 150g P, 250g K/tree.

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation and Weed Control (Year-round): Drip irrigation, manual weeding.

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest and Disease Management: Papaya mealybug â€“ Neem oil (5ml/L water).

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (9-12 months after planting): Year-round fruiting. Yield: 40-50 tons/ha.
ğŸ Custard Apple \n (Sitaphal - Balanagar, Arka Sahan, NMK-1)

âœ… Season: Monsoon (June-Aug) & Post-Monsoon (Sept-Dec).

 âœ… Climate: Thrives in semi-arid climate (25-35Â°C), low rainfall (50-100 cm).

 âœ… Soil: Best in red sandy loam or black cotton soil.

 âœ… Usage: Consumed fresh, pulp used in ice creams, milkshakes.

 âœ… Maharashtra Relevance: Grown in Beed, Solapur, Nashik, Pune.

 Cultivation Process & Time Period

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (May-June): Deep plowing, 8-10 tons/ha FYM applied.

 2ï¸âƒ£ Planting (June-July): 5x5m spacing, deep pits for seedlings.

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (July-Oct): 300g N, 150g P, 300g K/tree.

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (June-Feb): Drip irrigation, mulching for weed control.

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Fruit borer â€“ Neem oil or Malathion (2ml/L water).

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Sept-Dec): 3-4 years after planting. Yield: 8-12 tons/ha.

âœ… Season: Summer & Kharif

 âœ… Climate: Warm & humid (25-35Â°C), rainfall 70-150 cm

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained sandy loam to clay loam, rich in organic matter

 âœ… Usage: Used in curries, soups, fritters; also for skincare (when matured)

 âœ… Maharashtra Relevance: Grown in Pune, Kolhapur, Nagpur regions

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (Feb-March & June-July): 15-20 tons/ha FYM incorporated, field well-tilled and leveled

 2ï¸âƒ£ Planting (March-April & July-Aug): Direct seeding or seedling transplanting at 1.5-2 m row spacing, 0.5-0.6 m between plants

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (April-Sept): 60 kg N, 50 kg P, 50 kg K/ha; half N at sowing, half after 30 days

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (April-Oct): Light irrigation every 6-8 days; 2-3 manual weedings

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Red pumpkin beetle â€“ Neem oil spray (5ml/L); Downy mildew â€“ Copper oxychloride spray (3g/L)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (May-Nov): 50-70 days after sowing, picking at tender stage, average yield 20-25 tons/ha
ğŸ§… Onion \n (N-53, Bhima Super, Agrifound Light Red)

âœ… Season: Rabi & Kharif

 âœ… Climate: Warm & dry (15-25Â°C), rainfall 50-100 cm

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained loamy soil

 âœ… Usage: Used in curries, pickles, dehydrated onion flakes

 âœ… Maharashtra Relevance: Grown in Nashik, Ahmednagar, Pune

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (June-July & Oct-Nov): FYM 20 tons/ha applied

 2ï¸âƒ£ Planting (July-Aug & Nov-Dec): Seeds sown at 15x10 cm spacing

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (Aug-Feb): 100 kg N, 50 kg P, 80 kg K/ha

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (Aug-March): Drip irrigation, manual weeding

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Thrips â€“ Neem oil spray (3ml/L water)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Jan-May): 110-140 days after planting, yield 25-30 tons/ha
ğŸŒ¶ï¸ Chili \n (Pusa Jwala, G-4, Arka Meghana)

âœ… Season: Kharif & Rabi

 âœ… Climate: Warm & dry (20-35Â°C), rainfall 60-100 cm

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained sandy loam

 âœ… Usage: Used in spices, pickles, dried chili powder

 âœ… Maharashtra Relevance: Found in Kolhapur, Sangli, Nashik

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (June-July & Oct-Nov): FYM 15-20 tons/ha applied

 2ï¸âƒ£ Planting (July-Aug & Nov-Dec): Seedlings transplanted at 60x45 cm spacing

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (Aug-Feb): 90 kg N, 60 kg P, 50 kg K/ha

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (Aug-March): Drip irrigation, 2-3 weedings

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Aphids â€“ Neem oil spray (2ml/L water)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Jan-May): 120-150 days after transplanting, yield 20-25 tons/ha

âœ… Season: Kharif & Summer

 âœ… Climate: Warm & humid (20-35Â°C), rainfall 50-120 cm

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained sandy loam

 âœ… Usage: Used in curries, pickles, fried dishes

 âœ… Maharashtra Relevance: Cultivated in Solapur, Ahmednagar, Pune

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (June-July & Feb-March): FYM 15-20 tons/ha applied

 2ï¸âƒ£ Sowing (July-Aug & March-April): Spacing 50x30 cm, direct seeding

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (Aug-Dec): 80 kg N, 50 kg P, 60 kg K/ha

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (Aug-Jan): Drip irrigation, manual weeding

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Shoot & fruit borer â€“ Neem oil spray (3ml/L water)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Oct-Jan): 60-70 days after sowing, yield 10-12 tons/ha

âœ… Season: Kharif & Rabi

 âœ… Climate: Warm (20-30Â°C), moderate rainfall 60-100 cm

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained loamy soil with high organic matter

 âœ… Usage: Used in curries, pickles, and stuffed dishes

 âœ… Maharashtra Relevance: Cultivated in Nashik, Pune, Solapur

 Cultivation Process & Time Period

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (June-July & Oct-Nov): FYM 20-25 tons/ha applied

 2ï¸âƒ£ Planting (July-Aug & Nov-Dec): Seedlings transplanted at 60x60 cm spacing

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (Aug-Feb): 120 kg N, 80 kg P, 60 kg K/ha

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (Aug-March): Drip irrigation, manual weeding

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Shoot borer â€“ Neem oil spray (4ml/L water)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Nov-April): 120-140 days after transplanting, yield 35-40 tons/ha
ğŸ¥¦ Cauliflower (Gobhi) \n (Pusa Snowball, Punjab Giant, Pusa Deepali)

âœ… Season: Rabi & Kharif

 âœ… Climate: Cool temperature (15-25Â°C), rainfall 50-80 cm

 âœ… Soil: Well-drained loamy soil with good fertility

 âœ… Usage: Used in curries, pickles, processed foods

 âœ… Maharashtra Relevance: Found in Pune, Nashik, Satara

 Cultivation Process & Time Period:

 1ï¸âƒ£ Land Preparation (July-Aug): FYM 15-20 tons/ha applied

 2ï¸âƒ£ Planting (Aug-Sept): Spacing 45x45 cm, seedlings transplanted

 3ï¸âƒ£ Nutrient Management (Aug-Dec): 100 kg N, 60 kg P, 80 kg K/ha

 4ï¸âƒ£ Irrigation & Weed Control (Aug-Jan): Drip irrigation, 2-3 manual weedings

 5ï¸âƒ£ Pest & Disease Management: Diamondback moth â€“ Neem oil spray (5ml/L water)

 6ï¸âƒ£ Harvesting (Nov-Jan): 90-110 days after transplanting, yield 20-25 tons/ha

The Crop Guide Application helps you explore complete crop information for grains, fruits, and vegetables. Select your location and crop, and get detailed guidance from planting to cultivation. Plus, discover relevant government schemes and support programs to boost your farming journey! Perfect for farmers, students, and agriculture enthusiasts.
ğŸŒ¾ Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY)
This scheme provides insurance coverage and financial support to farmers in the event of crop failure due to natural calamities, pests, or diseases.
- All farmers growing notified crops in a notified area.\n- Must have an insurable interest (land ownership or tenancy).\n- Loanee and non-loanee farmers are eligible.

- Covers all food and oilseed crops and annual commercial/horticultural crops.
- Premium Rates:
 â€¢ 2% for Kharif crops
 â€¢ 1.5% for Rabi crops
 â€¢ 5% for commercial/horticultural crops
- Balance premium paid by government subsidy.
- Claims calculated using remote sensing and weather data.
- Kharif Season: Typically April to July\n- Rabi Season: October to December
Apply through the nearest bank, Common Service Centre (CSC), or online at https://pmfby.gov.in/
Provides â‚¹6,000 per year in 3 equal installments to eligible farmer families, directly into their bank accounts.

Small and marginal farmers with up to 2 hectares of land.

The scheme was later extended to all land-holding farmers, except:

- Institutional landholders
- Income tax payers
- Retired professionals holding constitutional posts
\u20B92,000 every four months (Aprilâ€“July, Augâ€“Nov, Decâ€“March).\n\nMust have Aadhaar-linked bank account and land records.
Online via https://pmkisan.gov.in\n\nOr visit local CSC centers or agriculture department office.
ğŸŒ¾ 3. Pradhan Mantri Kisan Maandhan Yojana (PM-KMY)
A voluntary and contributory pension scheme for small and marginal farmers offering â‚¹3,000 monthly pension after the age of 60.
- Age: 18â€“40 years\n- Landholding: Up to 2 hectares\n- Must not be covered under EPFO, NPS, or any government pension scheme.

- Monthly contribution: â‚¹55â€“â‚¹200 based on age.
- Government contributes an equal amount.
- Pension begins at age 60.
- Option to exit with contributions if farmer dies or opts out.
Apply through CSC centers. Aadhaar, land documents, and savings bank account are required.
This scheme provides medium to long-term debt financing for investment in viable agricultural infrastructure like cold storage, warehouses, and supply chain facilities.
- Farmers, FPOs, PACS, agri-entrepreneurs, startups, and cooperatives.\n- State agencies and local bodies also eligible.
- Loans up to â‚¹2 crore per project at subsidized interest.\n- Interest subvention: 3% per annum up to â‚¹2 crore for 7 years.\n- Credit guarantee available for eligible borrowers.
- Scheme valid from 2020 to 2032.\n- Apply any time within this duration.
Apply online via https://agriinfra.dac.gov.in\nOr visit your local bank for guided application process.
